body.p:
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Marshall County

Greeting: Whereas it satisfactorily appears to me that at a special term of the Marshall Circuit Court held in the month of July 18665, that Samuel Gains was duly Convicted and adjudged by said Court ^To be guilty of the crime of murder and was adjudged & sentenced by said court^ to be hanged by the neck until he was dead on the 15th day of September 1865 and whereas it further appears that said Samuel Gains before the day fixed for execution as aforesaid, escaped from the jail of said County ^& fled from justice^ and was not hanged as adjudged; and whereas it further appears that he has since that time been arrested and is now ^in custody being^ Confined in the jail of said County; now therefore, you are Commanded as sheriff of Marshall County on ^Friday^ the 13th day of July -- 1866 between the hours of sunset ^rise^ and sunriseset to execute said judgment of death by hanging said Samuel Gains by the neck until he is dead,
In testimony where I have Caused this warrant to be issued under my hand, and the seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed.
Form of Warrant for Hanging after term expires
